meanings.definition: Tending to diminish in value over time.
meanings.sent1: The old car had a depreciative price tag.
meanings.sent2: The real estate market can be affected by depreciative factors.
meanings.sent3: His jokes about the outdated technology were depreciative but funny.
meanings.sent4: The artist's fading popularity was a depreciative reality.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant colors of the painting now looked depreciative.
